As per Twitter's current policy, people can have the same phone number associated with up to 10 Twitter accounts. Further, verified accounts are required to have a verified phone number or email address attached to them.

174.title: Feeling of being called Test cricketer is different: Chahal on Test ambition
174.article_body: Talking about the thought of playing Test cricket for India, spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said the feeling of being called a Test cricketer is completely different. "In my last 10 first-class games I have fifty wickets," he added. The 32-year-old, who made his India debut in June 2016, hasn't made his Test debut so far.

175.title: Lancet warns about 'tomato flu' virus in India that leaves children with red blisters
175.article_body: The Lancet journal has warned about 'tomato flu' virus that has affected children in parts of India. The infection has been named 'tomato flu' because of the red, painful blisters that appear on a patient's body and gradually enlarge to the size of a tomato. It said that the virus is "very contagious" but is considered non-life-threatening.

176.title: 5 killed in wall collapse incidents amid heavy rain in Odisha
176.article_body: Five people, including four children, died and five others were injured in separate wall collapse incidents amid heavy rainfall across Odisha, officials said on Saturday. Two children died and their parents suffered injuries after the mud wall of their house collapsed in Mayurbhanj district. Similarly, a four-year-old girl died in Balasore, whereas a nine-year-old boy died in Koraput district.

177.title: 9-yr-old abducted, raped & killed by villager in Ghaziabad; arrested
177.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and murdering a nine-year-old girl in Ghaziabad's Modinagar. The accused reportedly abducted the victim and her six-year-old cousin on his bicycle on the pretext of buying them ice cream. He left the younger girl behind and went into a dense isolated spot with the older girl, where he raped and murdered her.

178.title: 3 boys kill man in front of daughter over rivalry with his son in Pune
178.article_body: Three minor boys reportedly hacked a 52-year-old man to death in front of his daughter over an old rivalry with his son in Pune. The incident took place when the deceased had gone to pick up his daughter from school, according to reports. The trio's rivalry with the deceased's son was apparently over a girl in their college.

179.title: Request PM to give justice to Bilkis Bano: Owaisi on release of rapists
179.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised the Centre after 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case were granted remission. "There is a government circular that says the rapists should not be remitted on Independence Day and BJP has taken the decision against that too. We request PM Modi with folded hands to give justice to her." said Owaisi.

180.title: Mumbai Police constable rapes sex worker after failed raid
180.article_body: A constable of the MHB Police Station allegedly raped a sex worker in Mumbai. The police had conducted a raid to bust a prostitution racket which failed as they could not apply charges of solicitation. Later the accused, Rajratan Kale (42), took the victim to a hotel and allegedly raped her. The complaint was filed at the Kanakia Police Station.

181.title: What is the controversy over IRCTC's tender to monetise passenger data?
181.article_body: IRCTC has floated a tender to hire a consultant to study its customers' personal data with an aim to monetise it, the company's website showed. The tender has sparked concerns regarding the data privacy of customers. As per the tender, the hired consultant will be required to study customer data, including name, mobile number, e-mail ID, and login or password.

182.title: Arrested TMC leader Anubrata taken to hospital for medical check-up
182.article_body: TMC leader Anubrata Mondal, arrested in a cattle smuggling case, was taken for a medical check-up and will later be produced in court today. He was reportedly summoned several times by the CBI to appear for questioning, however, he evaded the summons citing his health. He was arrested on August 11 from his residence in Birbhum, West Bengal.

183.title: UN calls for release of Saudi woman sentenced to 34 yrs for tweeting
183.article_body: The UN Human Rights Office, OHCHR, expressed outrage over a 34-year prison sentence handed down to Saudi student Salma al-Shehab in connection with a series of tweets and retweets on political and human rights issues in Saudi Arabia. "We urge...Saudi authorities to quash her conviction and release her immediately," OHCHR spokesperson Liz Throssell said. The 34-year-old was arrested in 2021.

184.title: Need to ensure cricketing demands are fulfilled more than anything: Pandit
184.article_body: KKR head coach Chandrakant Pandit said he will try to be flexible in his methods while coaching the KKR players but added he will ensure cricketing demands are fulfilled more than anything else. Discussing Pandit's recent appointment, former India opener Aakash Chopra had said, "Pandit scolds the players a lot...Will the same strategy work with the international players?"

185.title: Centre worried about Kejriwal, not corruption: Delhi Dy CM Manish Sisodia
185.article_body: After CBI raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence on Friday, the AAP leader accused the Centre of using the investigation agencies to further political motives. "Corruption is not what PM Narendra Modi is worried about...The Centre is just worried about the meteoric rise of...Kejriwal," Sisodia said. "BJP is...using...CBI and ED to implicate Opposition leaders in false cases," he said.

186.title: Woman gets ₹4 lakh compensation after being asked her age at Domino's interview in UK
186.article_body: A woman who was asked her age during a job interview at Domino's Pizza in Northern Ireland's County Tyrone has received an apology and a financial settlement of £4,250 (around ₹4 lakh). She believed she was turned down for the role of delivery driver due to her age and sex. She then filed a discrimination case against the franchise.

187.title: Barcelona star Lewandowski's watch worth ₹56 lakh stolen, thief buries the watch
187.article_body: Barcelona forward Robert Lewandowski's watch worth €70,000 (₹56 lakh) was stolen after he stopped to sign autographs for fans outside the club's practice facilities. The thief opened the passenger door of Lewandowski's car and swiped the watch. Lewandowski tried to chase him but he ran away. Later, police tracked down and detained the thief, who had buried the watch.

188.title: Snap halts work on selfie drone Pixy months after launch: Report
188.article_body: Snap is shutting down development of future versions of Pixy, a drone-powered camera that can record videos and photos to be shared on the Snapchat app, The Wall Street Journal reported. The decision comes less than four months after Snap CEO Evan Spiegel unveiled the device. The company plans to continue selling the current version of Pixy, the report said.

189.title: 2 drivers killed, 10 students injured as K'taka school bus collides with another bus
189.article_body: Two people were killed after a school bus collided with another bus heading in the opposite direction in Athani in Belagavi district of Karnataka. Ten students were also injured in the incident. The incident took place in the early hours of Saturday. Those who lost their lives in the incident include drivers of both the vehicles.

190.title: Flash flood-like situation near Dehradun; video of Tapkeshwar temple surfaces
190.article_body: A flash flood-like situation was reported from various areas in Uttarakhand's Dehradun following a cloudburst. A video from Tapkeshwar Mahadev temple has surfaced online. Tamasa river nearby breached its banks due to continuous torrential rainfall. "Due to this...contact of Mata Vaishno Devi Cave Yoga Temple and Tapkeshwar Mahadev has been lost...pool has been damaged," the temple's founder said.

191.title: JP Nadda to visit poll-bound Himachal to discuss poll strategy
191.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda is set to visit Nahan in Himachal Pradesh to chalk out strategy for the upcoming Assembly elections to be held later this year. "I am on a very emotional two-day visit to Himachal Pradesh. I will get the opportunity to visit Nahan, where I worked for the organisation in my youth," Nadda said.

192.title: CBI's plumes are saffron: Kapil Sibal after raids on Sisodia
192.article_body: Former Congress leader Kapil Sibal called the CBI an "uncaged parrot" after the probe agency conducted raids at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence. "CBI, once a 'caged parrot' is now uncaged. Now, its plumes are saffron...It parrots what his master says!" said Sibal. Raids were conducted in seven states in connection with the alleged excise policy scam.

193.title: UP university bars over 9,800 students from exams for mass copying
193.article_body: A university in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj has debarred over 9,800 students from giving examinations for a year after they were allegedly found guilty of mass copying during annual examinations, university officials said on Friday. The administration of Prof Rajendra Singh (Rajju Bhaiya) University had conducted surprise inspections during various semester examinations, officials added.

194.title: CJI NV Ramana inaugurates new City Courts Complex in Vijayawada
194.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana inaugurated the new City Courts Complex in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada on Saturday. Built at a cost of ₹100 crore, the complex will house all courts under one roof. It's spread over an area of about 15,000 square metres and has 29 court halls with special chambers for sessions judges and magistrates, among other facilities.

195.title: Educational institutions shut in Himachal's Mandi amid heavy rains
195.article_body: Owing to the incessant rains, all government and private educational institutions except colleges and ITI will be closed throughout Mandi, Himachal Pradesh. Kullu district administration has also announced to shut all the schools and Anganwadi Centres. Heavy rainfall has battered many parts of the state and due to this several roads are blocked.

196.title: 11 arrested in separate cases, including theft, across Bengaluru
196.article_body: The Bengaluru Police on Friday arrested 11 people in separate cases across the city. Ten people were arrested in Bengaluru's Chikkajala area in four different cases of theft, DCP (North East), Anoop A Shetty tweeted. Further, one person was arrested in Devanahalli police station limits for creating fake land documents, Shetty said, adding that he was sent to judicial custody.

197.title: IFS officer shares pic of animal's jaw, asks people to guess name
197.article_body: IFS officer Surender Mehra shared a picture of an animal's jaw and asked people if they could guess its name. He later also shared a picture showing the "full view" of the image. Responding to the officer's tweet, several users of the social media platform commented that it is a "ghariyal".

198.title: Nepal opens its first-ever human milk bank for at-risk infants
198.article_body: Nepal President Bidya Devi Bhandari on Friday inaugurated the nation's first-ever human milk bank at a maternity and women's hospital in Kathmandu. The centre has been established in partnership between the Government of Nepal, European Union and UNICEF. "The milk bank...gives premature...and other at-risk infants access to the vast benefits of breastmilk when they need it the most," UNICEF said.

199.title: Facebook contractors chosen 'at random' by an algorithm fired in US: Report
199.article_body: US-based Accenture recently told some of its employees that their work for Facebook "was soon being taken away", Insider has reported. The contractors, who were employed by Meta, were reportedly informed about their termination during a video call with nameless Accenture representatives. As many as 60 contractors were told they had been chosen for layoff "at random" via an algorithm.

200.title: Had LG not changed excise policy, Delhi would make ₹10,000 cr per yr: Dy CM
200.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that had Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) not changed the decision on the excise policy, the Delhi government would have been getting at least ₹10,000 crore every year. "Excise policy due to which whole controversy is created is the country's best policy," he added. CBI on Friday raided Sisodia's residence.

201.title: Kejriwal on the rise, so time for BJP to destabilise: Kapil Sibal
201.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal took a swipe at CBI, ED and BJP-led government over raids at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence. "Sisodia raided by CBI. CBI, ED - the long arms of government. Now that [CM Arvind] Kejriwal is on the rise. Time for BJP to destabilise. So target [AAP leader] Satyendar Jain. Now Sisodia," tweeted Sibal.

202.title: CBI raid not over corruption, but to stop Arvind Kejriwal: Sisodia
202.article_body: After CBI raided his residence over an alleged liquor policy scam, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that the raid wasn't over corruption but to "stop the rise" of the national capital's CM Arvind Kejriwal. "I haven't done any corruption. I'm just...Kejriwal's Education Minister," he added. "Their target is Arvind Kejriwal because he works for development," he further said.

203.title: Video shows railway bridge collapsing amid flash flood in Himachal Pradesh
203.article_body: A railway bridge built on Chakki river in Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh collapsed amid flash flood and heavy rainfall. A video of the incident has also surfaced online. Mandi district also saw flash flooding on Saturday, with water entering houses and shops, trapping residents and damaging vehicles parked on the road, officials said.

204.title: Mexico arrests former Attorney General in 2014 missing students' case
204.article_body: Mexico's former Attorney General has been arrested in connection with the disappearance of 43 students in September 2014. Jesus Karam, who led an inquiry into the disappearance, has been charged with forced disappearance, torture and obstruction of justice. The students reportedly went missing while travelling by bus through the city of Iguala on their way to a protest.

205.title: Xiaomi's Q2 revenue falls 20% to $10.31 bn, net income drops 67%
205.article_body: China's Xiaomi posted a revenue of 70.17 billion yuan ($10.31 billion) in the second quarter of this year, recording a year-on-year drop of 20%. The consumer electronics maker's adjusted net income also dropped 67% year-on-year in Q2. Xiaomi President Wang Xiang said the resurgence of the COVID-19 pandemic in the country resulted in "difficult and weak" demand.

206.title: Teacher threatens student with physical abuse over BTS remark, later apologises
206.article_body: A teacher has apologised after a video of him mocking and threatening to beat up a female student went viral. The student had allegedly spammed the comments section of the online class with South Korean boy band-related messages. Mocking her for liking BTS, Misra had said, "If you weren't a girl, I would have grabbed your collar and slapped you."

207.title: Maybe within 3-4 days, CBI-ED will arrest me: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia
207.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that CBI-ED might arrest him within the next three-four days. "We won't be scared, you won't be able to break us...the elections of 2024 will be AAP vs BJP," he added. CBI has named 15 accused, including Sisodia, in its FIR over the Centre's allegations of corruption in the liquor policy.

208.title: Pregnant woman abducted, gangraped by 4 men for 3 days in UP
208.article_body: A two-month pregnant woman on Friday alleged she was abducted and gangraped by four men over a period of three days in Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi district, police said. When a police team reached the house where she was allegedly held captive, a woman there claimed the survivor's relatives had left her there in exchange for ₹80,000, police added.

209.title: Girls & boys sitting together in class will cause problems: IUML leader
209.article_body: Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) leader PMA Salam has triggered a controversy while criticising gender-neutral education in Kerala schools. "What is the need for girls and boys to sit together in classrooms? Why are you forcing them or creating such opportunities? It will only cause problems," Salam said, according to India Today. "Students will deviate from studies," he added.

210.title: Wasn't offered 'Udta Punjab', had to convince director for role: Alia
210.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said 'Udta Punjab' is the only film where she did "method acting", adding she had to convince director Abhishek Chaubey for her role, having not been offered originally. "He wasn't sure...I worked bloody hard [and convinced him]," added Alia. "I didn't have a phone...I had no entertainment...I learned hockey for one month for...one shot," she stated.

211.title: K'taka CM Bommai orders probe into death threat calls to Siddaramaiah
211.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday ordered a thorough investigation into death threat calls to Congress MLA and Opposition leader Siddaramaiah. "We have taken this issue seriously. I have given instruction to provide adequate security to the Leader of the Opposition," Bommai added. This comes after Siddaramaiah claimed that he received death threats over his remarks on Veer Savarkar.

212.title: 38-year-old man stabbed to death in Delhi; suspects identified
212.article_body: A 38-year-old grocery shop owner was stabbed to death in Delhi's Bhajanpura, police said on Friday. The man was found unconscious at his shop, following which he was taken to a hospital where he was declared brought dead, a police officer said. The police added that four suspects were spotted escaping from the scene on CCTV and they've been identified.

213.title: Bridgerton actress Phoebe visits India, shares pics of Taj Mahal, Humayun's Tomb
213.article_body: Actress Phoebe Dynevor of Bridgerton fame recently visited India and shared pictures of Taj Mahal in Agra and Humayun's Tomb in Delhi. "A few from the past couple of months. Cairo to Delhi to Seoul. What a beautiful ride," she wrote on Instagram. The other pictures include Great Sphinx of Giza and the Pyramids in Egypt.

214.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd ODI against Zimbabwe
214.article_body: Team India captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against Zimbabwe in the second ODI in Harare. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Shardul Thakur replacing Deepak Chahar. Zimbabwe have made 2 changes to their playing XI. Notably, India are on a 13-match winning streak in ODI cricket against Zimbabwe.

215.title: Sachin played me the best, all other batters were scared: Akhtar on 1999 WC
215.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said all batters except Sachin Tendulkar were "scared" of him during the 1999 World Cup. "Many batters...[would] stop moving their feet...Sachin played me the best," added Akhtar. Akhtar earlier admitted he wanted to "intentionally hit" Sachin during a Test match in Karachi in 2006. "I hit him on his helmet and I thought...he'll die," he'd stated.

216.title: Pune Municipal Corporation to start heritage walk from today
216.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will begin a heritage walk from today in a bid to raise awareness about the city's history. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said that there are around 250 heritage structures in Pune and added, "It's become necessary to conserve its rich historical and cultural importance in...fast progressing era." 'Know Pune' heritage walk will be launched first.

217.title: 1 killed, 13 others feared dead in flash flood, landslide in Himachal's Mandi
217.article_body: At least one person was killed and 13 others are feared dead in a landslide and flash flood amid heavy rains in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi, officials said. A girl's body was recovered about half a kilometre away from her house in the Baghi Nullah area on Friday night, while five members of her family were washed away, officials added.

218.title: 81-yr-old Danish woman arrested at Poland airport with 5 kg heroin
218.article_body: An 81-year-old Danish woman, carrying five kilograms of heroin worth over $515,000, was arrested at Frederic Chopin Airport in Poland, officials said. The woman was travelling from Malawi and Kenya to Canada via Qatar and Poland. Customs officers decided to check the woman's luggage after becoming suspicious of her uneasy behaviour. The heroin was discovered under a false suitcase bottom.

219.title: Paytm spends ₹600 crore on tech every year: CFO Madhur Deora
219.article_body: Paytm spends ₹600 crore on tech every year, the company's Group Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Madhur Deora said at the company's annual general meeting (AGM) on Friday. This is besides the ₹4,000 crore the company spends on employee-related costs, Deora added. He further said that the company's employee attrition rate is in the range of 2 to 2.5% per month.

220.title: Chakki bridge in Himachal's Kangra collapses due to heavy rains, video surfaces
220.article_body: Chakki bridge in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district collapsed on Saturday, ADM Kangra said. Reports said that the bridge collapsed due to heavy rainfall and floods in the area. A video of the incident went viral on social media. Meanwhile, heavy rainfall is likely to take place in Kangra, Chamba, Bilaspur, Sirmaur and Mandi districts of Himachal Pradesh today, reports added.

221.title: Adani Power to acquire DB Power for ₹7,017 crore in all-cash deal
221.article_body: Adani Power has announced that it will acquire DB Power for an enterprise value of ₹7,017 crore in an all-cash deal. DB Power owns and operates a thermal power plant in Chhattisgarh. Following the acquisition, Adani Power will own 100% of DPPL, the holding company of DB Power. The deal is subject to approval from the Competition Commission of India.

222.title: Heroes are just 'too emotional', too much 'chik-chik': Rhea Kapoor
222.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor's daughter and producer Rhea Kapoor took to Instagram to share that women are "braver" and "more fun" than men. "I'm not interested in making 'women-centric' films. What the f**k is a 'women-centric' film? My films just happen to have women," added Rhea. "Also, heroes are just too sensitive and emotional. Too much chik-chik. Na?" she stated.

223.title: 3 people missing after house collapses following landslide in HP's Chamba
223.article_body: Three people went missing after a house collapsed following a landslide triggered by heavy rains in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba district on Saturday, ANI reported. The incident occurred around 4:30 am and a search operation has been launched, officials said. Earlier this morning, a flash flood was also reported in state's Mandi district, causing water to enter houses and damaging vehicles.

224.title: Tharoor shares pic of Rajiv Gandhi's pilot licence on his birth anniversary
224.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor shared a picture of Rajiv Gandhi's private pilot licence on the former PM's birth anniversary. "Remembering Rajiv Gandhi on what would have been his 78th birthday. He piloted the nation to greater heights but was cruelly snatched from us in mid-flight," he tweeted. Rajiv Gandhi was assassinated in 1991.

225.title: Rakesh Tikait asks farmers to be ready for nationwide agitation
225.article_body: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait has asked farmers to be ready for a nationwide agitation over their demands, including a law on MSP and the removal of Union Minister Ajay Misra Teni. He was addressing farmers at a sit-in organised by Samyukta Kisan Morcha. "If SKM gets weakened, governments will get the better of farmers," Tikait said.

226.title: Rahul, Priyanka pay tributes to Rajiv Gandhi on his 78th birth anniversary
226.article_body: On the occasion of former PM Rajiv Gandhi's 78th birth anniversary, Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi paid tributes to their father at Vir Bhumi, Delhi. Posting a video on Twitter, Rahul Gandhi wrote, "Papa, you are with me every moment, in my heart. I will always try to fulfil the dream you dreamed for the country."

227.title: Pune sisters aged 17, 10, on way to school, die as lorry hits 2-wheeler
227.article_body: Two sisters, aged 17 and 10, died on Saturday morning after a speeding container lorry hit the two-wheeler they were riding on, police said. The incident took place on Pune-Solapur Highway. The sisters were on their way to school along with their uncle when the accident took place around 7 am, police added. Their uncle was injured in the incident.

228.title: Punjab declared 'controlled area' after African swine fever confirmed in Patiala
228.article_body: The entire state of Punjab has been declared as "controlled area" after African swine fever was confirmed in swine samples of Patiala, Punjab Animal Husbandry Minister Laljit Singh Bhullar on Friday said. Bilaspur and Sanauri Adda in Patiala are hereby notified as "epicentre" of the disease, he added. Samples of unwell pigs from Patiala were sent to Bhopal for testing.

229.title: Challenge BJP to get article published in NYT: AAP MLA on 'paid news' remark
229.article_body: Reacting to BJP leaders' allegations that a New York Times (NYT) article on Delhi schools was "paid news", AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj said that he challenged BJP to use whatever money and power they have to get an article published in NYT if they think it's possible. "The donation [BJP] get is...maximum...Why couldn't you get paid news published?" he said.

230.title: Putin agrees to send IAEA mission to Ukraine nuclear plant
230.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin held talks with French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday and has agreed to send an International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) mission to the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine, the French presidency said. This comes as claims of fighting near the plant continue. The plant has been under the control of Russian troops since March.

231.title: New species of white & purple crab recognised in Karnataka; pic released
231.article_body: Karnataka Forest Department has released a picture of a new species of crab called 'Ghatiana dvivarna' that has been recognised in Idagundi Range of Yellapur Division. It's white and purple in colour. "Ghatiana dvivarna inhabits holes in the laterite rocks on the mountains of central Western Ghats. This is the 75th crab species recognised in Western Ghats," the department said.

232.title: Vaishno Devi Yatra resumes after temporary suspension
232.article_body: The Vaishno Devi Yatra in Jammu and Kashmir's Katra has resumed after a temporary suspension due to flash floods triggered by heavy rainfall in the region. "The police and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) have already been deployed. The situation is being monitored. No untoward incident reported so far," Vaishno Devi Shrine Board said.

233.title: Baseless: DOLO-650 makers on allegations of spending ₹1,000 crore on doctors
233.article_body: Bengaluru-based Micro Labs Limited has said allegations against the pharmaceutical firm that it spent ₹1,000 crore on doctors to prescribe it are "baseless and incorrect". "The brand did a business of just ₹350 crore when COVID-19 was at its peak, and, therefore, it was simply unviable for us to promote the drug by spending a much larger amount," it added.

234.title: Several parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts on August 21 & 22
234.article_body: Several parts of Bengaluru will face planned power cuts on August 21 and 22 as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) will carry out repair and maintenance works. Most of the work will be done between 10 am and 6 pm, News18 reported. The areas that will be affected on Sunday include Vivek Nagar, Victoria Layout, Richmond Park etc.

235.title: 6 die, 20 injured as tractor-trailer, truck collides in Raj; PM expresses grief
235.article_body: At least six people were killed and over 20 were injured as a tractor-trailer carrying pilgrims and a truck collided in Rajasthan's Pali on Friday night, police said. The pilgrims were returning from Jaisalmer's Ramdevra, where a temple of a folk deity is located. "In this hour of grief, my thoughts are with the bereaved families," PM Narendra Modi said.

236.title: K'taka reduces fellowship amount by 66% for minority PhD, MPhil students
236.article_body: Karnataka government has reduced the fellowship amount by 66% for minority PhD and MPhil students who joined in the academic year 2022-23. For PhD scholars who joined in 2020-21 and 2021-22, the fellowship amount has been reduced by 33%. The reduction is a result of depleting revenue of the state government due to COVID-19, the state Minority Welfare Department said.

237.title: Man sells newborn daughter for ₹6,000 in Assam; 3 arrested
237.article_body: A man allegedly sold his newborn daughter for ₹6,000 to another person in Assam's Biswanath, police said on Friday. Three people, including the man, have been arrested and the baby was rescued, according to police. The man's father had filed a complaint after he got suspicious when his son told him the baby had passed away at the hospital.

238.title: One should stop talking about it: Dortmund CEO on Ronaldo being linked
238.article_body: Hans-Joachim Watzke, the CEO of Bundesliga club Borussia Dortmund, said there's no contact "at all" between the club and Cristiano Ronaldo, over a potential move from Manchester United. "One should stop talking about it," added Watzke. Bayern Munich and Atletico Madrid earlier denied reports of Ronaldo being signed. AC Milan and Inter Milan reportedly rejected an opportunity to sign Ronaldo.

239.title: BJP expels OBC leader over 'Brahmins were fooling people' comment
239.article_body: Madhya Pradesh BJP expelled OBC leader Pritam Singh Lodhi from the party for six years after his comment on the Brahmin community. "Brahmins were fooling people in the name of offering religious rituals and prayers, and grabbing money and other things from commoners," Lodhi had said. He later said he would apologise to Brahmins "with his head at their feet".

240.title: Trudeau nominates 1st indigenous person to Canada's Supreme Court
240.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau has nominated Michelle O'Bonsawin as the first indigenous person to serve on Canada's Supreme Court. The move comes following decades of criticism over a lack of indigenous representation on the country's highest court. O'Bonsawin will take up her new position as one of nine judges in September after a non-binding vote later this month in Parliament.

241.title: SS Rajamouli 'opened a door' for all of us: Mani Ratnam on Baahubali
241.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam, whose film 'Ponniyin Selvan' starring Aishwarya Rai Bachchan will release in two parts, said SS Rajamouli "opened a door" for everyone, by showing a film can be successful even in two parts. "'Ponniyin Selvan'...became possible because of 'Baahubali'...I...really want to thank him," added Ratnam. Actor Rajinikanth earlier termed it as being on the "scale" of 'Baahubali'.

242.title: India reports 13,272 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,01,166
242.article_body: India has reported 13,272 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 15,754 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,01,166, while the death toll has risen to 5,27,289, according to the latest data.

243.title: 153 people injured during 'Dahi Handi' in Mumbai, 23 still under treatment
243.article_body: A total of 153 people were injured while forming the pyramid during 'Dahi Handi' in Mumbai, news agency ANI reported. Of the total, 130 people have been discharged while 23 others are still undergoing treatment. Meanwhile, Thane Municipal Corporation said that around 64 people were injured in the city during the 'Dahi Handi' celebrations.

244.title: US govt body condemns release of Bilkis rape convicts, says 'part of pattern in India'
244.article_body: After 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bilkis Bano and killing her family members were released, the US Commission on International Religious Freedom said, "USCIRF strongly condemns the early and unjustified release." Calling it a "travesty of justice", it added, "It's part of a pattern of impunity in India for those engaged in violence against religious minorities."

245.title: Raj only state where govt takes immediate action against crimes: Gehlot
245.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday said crimes occur across the country, but Rajasthan is the only state where government takes immediate action against them. "They (BJP) will call it 'Jungle Raj', but people understand everything and are supporting us," Gehlot added. His statement came after a nine-year-old Dalit boy was allegedly beaten to death by his teacher in Jalore.

246.title: Cloudburst in U'khand village, villagers rescued; Tamsa water level rises
246.article_body: A cloudburst took place in a village in Dehradun district of Uttarakhand on Saturday. Reports said that there has been a rise in the water level of Tamsa river. The state disaster response force (SDRF) rushed to the spot after residents of the village reported the cloudburst at 2.45 am. SDRF said all stranded villagers were rescued.

247.title: 5.2 magnitude earthquake hits Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow
247.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 5.2 on the Richter scale hit the north-northeast of Uttar Pradesh capital Lucknow at around 1.12 am on Saturday, the National Center for Seismology (NCS) said. The depth of the earthquake was 82 kilometres below the ground, it added. Reportedly, tremors were felt in neighbouring Lakhimpur Kheri and other districts of Uttar Pradesh and Delhi.

248.title: British High Commissioner trolls Manchester United fan at Delhi temple, shares video
248.article_body: British High Commissioner to India Alex Ellis took to Twitter to share a video of himself trolling a Manchester United fan at the ISKCON temple in Delhi. In the video, the fan can be heard telling Ellis that Lord Krishna will help Manchester United win, to which Ellis says, "Lord Krishna has a great sense of humour. Don't forget that."

249.title: Amazon sells obscene Radha-Krishna painting; police complaint filed in Bengaluru
249.article_body: Hindu Janajagruti Samiti has filed a police complaint against Amazon in Bengaluru after an obscene Radha-Krishna painting was being sold on the platform. 'Boycott Amazon' also started trending on social media over sale of the painting. Demanding unconditional apology, the Hindu organisation later claimed that Amazon "quietly" removed the painting from its site.

250.title: 8 people killed as militants take control of hotel in Somalia, say 'we'll shoot everyone'
250.article_body: At least eight civilians have been killed by al-Shabab militants who have taken control of a hotel in the Somali capital Mogadishu. In a statement, the militants said, "We'll shoot everyone." An affiliate of al-Qaeda, al-Shabab has engaged in a long running conflict with the federal government.

251.title: Speeding car hits 2 kids on bicycle in Raj; act caught on CCTV
251.article_body: Two children, aged 10 and 12, were seriously injured after a speeding car rammed into the bicycle they were riding on in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh. The CCTV footage of the incident, which took place on Thursday evening, purportedly shows the car speeding away while the children lay on the ground. The children were taken to two separate hospitals.

252.title: A lot of people have a 'crush' on Stefanos Tsitsipas: Venus Williams
252.article_body: Seven-time Grand Slam Champion Venus Williams said a "lot of people" have a "crush" on Greek tennis player Stefanos Tsitsipas, while reacting to a question on Instagram on whether she'd like to coach Tsitsipas. "But I'm...assuming you want me to coach someone with a great game," added Venus. Talking about her least favourite shot, Venus stated, "I can't give...any clues."

253.title: It was our mistake, will honour sales: EA on listing ₹4,799 FIFA 23 game for ₹4.8
253.article_body: Electronic Arts (EA) has admitted that it mistakenly offered the FIFA 23 Ultimate Edition on India's Epic Games store for ₹4.8 instead of ₹4,799 in July. In an email to customers, EA said it "scored a spectacular own-goal" by listing the game at an incorrect price. "It was our mistake...we'll be honouring all pre-purchases made at that price," EA wrote.

254.title: Al-Shabaab militants attack hotel in Somalia
254.article_body: The militant group al-Shabaab on Friday said its fighters have taken control of a hotel in the Somali capital, Mogadishu. The militants detonated two explosives outside the hotel before entering the building and opening fire, police said. In a statement, the terror group said its fighters "are shooting everyone" in the hotel. There's no information about the casualties so far.

255.title: CBI seized my computer, phone; we are not afraid: Sisodia after 14-hr raid at home
255.article_body: After a nearly 14-hour CBI raid at his residence, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said his computer and phone have been seized. "My family cooperated with them...We have not done any corruption or wrong. We are not afraid. We know CBI is being misused," he said, adding that efforts are being made to stop Delhi government's good works.

256.title: IISc Bangalore to get centre of excellence for 3D bioprinting
256.article_body: The Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore, signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with US-based firm CELLINK to set up a centre of excellence (CoE) for 3D bioprinting on its campus. The centre will get state-of-the-art 3D bioprinters from CELLINK, as per the agreement. It will focus on research on heart, bone, cartilage and cancer using 3D bioprinting.

257.title: Mark Zuckerberg sued by family of guard who died on his Hawaii property in 2019
257.article_body: Mark Zuckerberg is being sued by the family of a security guard who died at the billionaire's Hawaiian property in 2019. The guard died after suffering a heart attack when he was forced to climb a steep hill to return to compound, said the lawsuit. The family further alleged that Zuckerberg gave them a $7,500 check after the guard's death.

258.title: Maha labourer, threatened with 'shrap', smashes baba's head, kills him; held
258.article_body: A labourer was arrested after he smashed a self-proclaimed godman's head with a paver block and killed him in Maharashtra. "The accused revealed...he was upset with the baba...Late on August 13, he had come drunk and was reprimanded by the baba who threatened to give him a curse if he again came drunk," police said.

259.title: GHMC speeds up construction of Uppal flyover in Hyderabad
259.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has sped up work on the Uppal flyover. The civic body's standing committee recently approved an administrative sanction of ₹12 crore for relocation of power and water lines, which were causing a delay. Expected to cost ₹675 crore, the flyover will begin at Uppal Junction and end at Central Power Research Institute in Medipally.

260.title: 2 die, 6 injured during Janmashtami celebrations at Mathura's Bankey Bihari temple
260.article_body: At least two persons died and six others were injured during Janmashtami celebrations on Friday at Bankey Bihari temple in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, officials said. "During Mangala Aarti...one devotee fainted at the exit gate of the temple due to which movement of devotees was restricted," police added. "As there was a huge crowd, many inside the premises suffocated," police stated.

261.title: Residents claim builder vandalised temple in Gurugram; probe on
261.article_body: A probe is being conducted after residents of a society in Gurugram's Sector 109 filed complaints alleging that a builder and his aides vandalised a temple they were constructing and threatened them, police said. "These allegations are baseless. The...land has been allotted for a school," the builder told Indian Express. A police officer said that no case has been registered.

262.title: US asks judge to block $2.2 billion merger of Penguin Random House and Simon and Schuster
262.article_body: The Department of Justice urged a US judge to block a $2.2-billion merger of Penguin Random House and Simon and Schuster book publishers. It said that competition matters, adding that the industry shouldn't be treated differently from others. The largest five publishers control 90% of the market, and the combined company would control about half of it, the government said.

263.title: Bengaluru reports 935 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
263.article_body: Bengaluru reported 935 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,56,779 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Friday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,981. The number of active cases was 6,989, while the infection positivity rate stood at 6.74%.

264.title: Mumbai fashion store director dead; drink bottle, packets of tablets found
264.article_body: The director of Suvidha Fashion Store in Dadar was found dead on Thursday. Police suspect that the 46-year-old director died by suicide. Reports said that police found a soft drink bottle and empty packets of tablets near the body. The family said that the deceased had earlier attempted suicide four times and that he suffered from psychological problems.

265.title: Man killed in shooting at shopping centre in Sweden; teen arrested
265.article_body: Swedish police on Friday arrested a teenage boy for allegedly killing one man and injuring a woman in a shooting at a shopping centre in Malmo. Police have ruled out a possible "terrorist" motive and said the shooting appeared to be "an isolated incident connected to criminal groups". So far this year, 44 people have been shot dead in Sweden.

266.title: I was 1000% nervous that Trump's supporters would kill me: Alec Baldwin on 'Rust' incident
266.article_body: Actor Alec Baldwin, who accidentally shot cinematographer Halyna Hutchins dead on sets of 'Rust', said he was 1000% nervous that Donald Trump's supporters would kill him after Trump's remark that Baldwin probably shot her on purpose. He added, “Here was Trump...who instructed people to commit acts of violence...and he was pointing...fingers at me and saying...I was responsible for the death."

267.title: Sunken German WWII ships resurface in Danube River amid drought in Europe
267.article_body:
Explosives-laden German warships sunk during the World War-II have resurfaced after drought 
in Europe pushed Danube River to one of its lowest levels in almost a century. The ammunition on the ships can be dangerous to shipping, according to reports. "The German flotilla has left behind a big ecological disaster," said Velimir Trajilovic, who wrote a book on German ships.

268.title: Steve Jobs' Apple-1 computer prototype sells for over ₹5.4 crore in auction
268.article_body: Late Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs' Apple-1 computer prototype has been bought by a Bay Area collector in an auction for $677,196 (over ₹5.4 crore). The prototype was used by Jobs in 1976 to demonstrate the Apple-1 to Paul Terrell, owner of The Byte Shop in California, one of the first personal computer stores in the world, Boston-based RR Auction said.

269.title: Thought of drinking for Darlings, director said 'Stay away from alcohol': Vijay
269.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who plays actress Alia Bhatt's drunk husband in 'Darlings', said he thought of getting drunk and performing scenes with the assistants in their office. However, director Jasmeet K Reen said, "You please stay away from alcohol, because you are not at all Hamza when you are drunk". Vijay added that there was constant grin on his face.

270.title: Water supply to be hit across Pune on August 25 due to PMC works
270.article_body: There will be no supply of water across Pune on August 25. "[Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC)] has planned meter installation, maintenance and water supply line connection works at many areas, including Parvati and Cantonment water treatment plants," a PMC official said. However, the areas which are supplied water from the Bhama Askhed Dam won't be affected on the same day.

271.title: Dumper for Metro project falls into trench, driver dies in Pune
271.article_body: A 46-year-old dumper driver died after the vehicle fell into an about 25-feet-deep trench in Pune's Katraj, police said. This comes after the driver lost control of the dumper which was carrying raw material for the Metro project at Swargate, police added. "The driver received major injuries, eventually resulting in his death," police further said.

272.title: Man beaten up, head shaved on suspicion of theft in Delhi's Wazirabad
272.article_body: A man was allegedly caught and beaten after being tied to a pole in Delhi's Wazirabad on suspicion of theft. A video of the incident surfaced online, following which police filed a case. In the video, the man's hair is also purportedly shaved with a razor. The locals caught him red-handed after he allegedly stole a water motor, police said.

273.title: Finnish PM Sanna Marin takes drugs test after her party video goes viral
273.article_body: Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin on Friday said that she had taken a drugs test after a video of her partying went viral on social media. Vowing that she had never used illegal drugs, Marin further said her ability to perform her official duties had remained unimpaired. Marin became the world's youngest serving government leader in December 2019.

274.title: It'll work in any language except 'Hindi': Vijay on Samantha-starrer Kushi
274.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said his film 'Kushi', starring actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, will be released only in Southern states of India, adding it'll "work in any language except Hindi". "It's related to the script," added Deverakonda. "[A] lot of [aspects in first half]...come from me not knowing Hindi...If I release...[in] Hindi, I need to be a Hindi guy," he stated.

275.title: Hyd man poses as woman to blackmail people on social media, arrested
275.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested a man for posing as a woman on social media and blackmailing people. The accused reportedly initiated explicit video calls with victims after pretending to be a female fashion designer and demanded money by blackmailing them with screen recordings. According to police, the accused had been a victim of a similar scam in past.

276.title: SRK is full of energy round the clock like Ranveer Singh is now: Ramya Krishnan
276.article_body: Actress Ramya Krishnan said that actor Shah Rukh Khan is full of energy like actor "Ranveer Singh is now". "[Shah Rukh Khan] is such a sweetheart. It's been ages since I've seen him...A lovely person to work with, lovely co-star, very understanding. Though I was very new then...he was really nice to me," she added.

277.title: I know it was pretty basic: Zuckerberg after being mocked over metaverse selfie
277.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has responded after he was mocked for posting a low-resolution selfie of his metaverse avatar. Sharing another picture on Instagram, Zuckerberg said, "I know the photo I posted earlier...was pretty basic -- it was taken very quickly to celebrate a launch." He announced that there will be "major updates" to Meta's VR platform, Horizon Worlds, soon.

278.title: Hawala agent with terror links operating as Delhi trader arrested
278.article_body: An alleged Hawala operator was arrested from Jammu bus stand by Delhi Police and Jammu & Kashmir Police with the help of central agencies, officials said on Friday. The accused identified as Mohammad Yasin allegedly contributed to funding of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and Al-Badr terror groups. Yasin was reportedly operating under the guise of a garment trader from Delhi's Meena Bazar.

279.title: Delhi logs 1,417 fresh COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths
279.article_body: Delhi reported 1,417 new cases of COVID-19 on Friday and three deaths due to the infection, according to data shared by the health department. Delhi's COVID-19 death toll reached 26,411 with the fresh fatalities. The city witnessed a decline in its test positivity rate as a rate of 7.53% was registered on Friday against Thursday's 9.42%.

280.title: He has fantastic temperament: Ferguson as character witness for Giggs
280.article_body: Ex-Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson was called in as a character witness for his ex-player Ryan Giggs' trial. Ferguson told the court that Giggs had "fantastic temperament", adding that Giggs fulfilled everything they wished for and never lost his temper in front of him. Giggs is on trial on charges of assault and use of coercive behaviour against an ex-girlfriend.

281.title: Rice mill owned by Mondal's daughter raided, ₹30-lakh car found: Report
281.article_body: The CBI on Friday raided a rice mill owned by arrested TMC leader Anubrata Mondal's daughter, Sukanya, in West Bengal's Bolpur. "Five cars were parked inside the rice mill premises. A Ford Endeavour [worth around] ₹30 lakh was also found...This car...was often used by Mondal when he used to come to Kolkata from Bolpur," a report said quoting CBI officials.

282.title: CBI raids won't scare Manish Sisodia or AAP: Akhilesh Yadav
282.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said CBI raids on Manish Sisodia will not scare the Delhi Deputy CM or the AAP. "The BJP is frightened that the AAP is going to upset their plans in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat," added Yadav. He said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar breaking his alliance with the BJP was a good message to the opposition.

283.title: Railways to launch Mathura-Vrindavan intercity rail bus soon
283.article_body: On the occasion of the Janmashtami festival, the Indian Railways has announced that an intercity rail bus from Mathura to Vrindavan will be launched soon. The rail bus' capacity will be 50 passengers. The Ministry of Railways shared pictures of the rail bus on Twitter. Vrindavan is connected to Mathura by a 12 km long meter gauge rail track.

284.title: Girl run over by truck while trying to escape kidnappers in Bihar
284.article_body: A teenage girl in Bihar died after being run over by a truck while she was reportedly escaping her abductors. Two men allegedly abducted the girl on their motorcycle and she managed to fling herself off the running vehicle but was crushed under the truck behind them. Locals beat up the truck driver while the alleged abductors managed to escape.

285.title: 2 hybrid terrorists with arms & ammunition arrested in Kupwara
285.article_body: Two suspected hybrid terrorists were arrested by security forces in J&K's Kupwara district, police said on Friday. The duo was arrested following a lead received during the investigation of a case in which three hybrid terrorists were arrested in Handwara on August 4, police added. Two pistols and 58 pistol rounds were recovered from the duo's possession, police informed.

286.title: Still believe I belong: Daniel Ricciardo on F1 future rumours
286.article_body: Amid rumours about his future at McLaren and F1, Daniel Ricciardo said he "still thrives off" the sport and believes he "belongs". "I could probably keep going, but there are a few things...I still believe I belong and can do it," said Ricciardo. Reports said the team is looking to replace Ricciardo with F2 champion Oscar Piastri next year.

287.title: Brilliant effort from team: Elgar on SA winning 1st Test vs England on Day 3
287.article_body: After South Africa won the first Test against England by an innings and 12 runs, South Africa captain Dean Elgar said it was a brilliant effort from the team and they didn't expect the game to finish so quickly. South Africa won the match on third day. Kagiso Rabada was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 5/52 and 2/27.

288.title: I would love ODIs to continue, have some meaning: Scott Styris
288.article_body: Former New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris said that he would love the ODI format to continue and have some meaning apart from only being featured at the Cricket World Cup. "I felt ODI was a mixture of power...Power, speed...all of that kicks in as well as the traditional cricket where there is the rotation of the strike," Styris said.

289.title: Wish for peaceful relations with India based on equity: Pak PM
289.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said he wishes for peaceful relations with India on the basis of "equity, justice and mutual respect", local media reported on Friday. "The international community has to play a facilitative role...as it was essential for...stability in South Asia," he said. Sharif made the comments during a meeting with the new Australian High Comm­issioner to Pakistan.

290.title: Wasim Jaffer trolls 'Bazball' after South Africa defeat England by an innings and 12 runs
290.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer trolled England over 'Bazball' after South Africa defeated them by an innings and 12 runs in the Lord's Test. Jaffer wrote, "'Bazball has done wonders in the fourth innings'...South Africa: There will be no fourth innings." England were bowled out for 165 in the first innings and 149 in the second innings.

291.title: I have been in favour of IPL's expansion for the past 10 years: Styris
291.article_body: After IPL got an extended window in the recently released 2023-27 Future Tours Program (FTP) cycle, former New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris said that he has been in "favour" of it. "I was in favour of it 10 years ago...I'm in favour of it now...We are starting to get there [3-month IPL season] now," Styris said.

292.title: Broke a very tough Dahi Handi 1.5 months back: Maha CM Shinde
292.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said he and his supporters "broke a very tough Dahi Handi one-and-a-half months back". "It was very difficult, high, and we had to put up 50 strong layers but we succeeded," said the CM. He was alluding to the rebellion he led against the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena and its alliance with NCP and Congress.

293.title: TN inspector held for alleged role in bank heist; 3.7-kg gold seized
293.article_body: A police inspector was arrested for his alleged role in helping the perpetrators who robbed FedBank in Tamil Nadu's Chennai, police said on Friday. Additional Commissioner of Police TS Anbu said, "Robbery accused Santosh, brother-in-law of [inspector] Amalraj, kept gold [at] Amalraj's residence. Amalraj knew this but didn't inform the police." Police seized 3.7 kg of gold from Amalraj's residence.

294.title: 31 locations across India raided in Delhi excise policy case: CBI
294.article_body: CBI said that it is conducting raids at 31 locations across India including Delhi, Mumbai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and Bengaluru in the Delhi excise policy case. "Searches are being conducted...have led to the recovery of incriminating documents/articles, digital records, etc," said the CBI. The agency is probing a corruption case filed against the introduction of the new Delhi liquor policy.

295.title: Haryana SI sexually harasses physically challenged woman, arrested
295.article_body: A Sub-Inspector (SI) in Haryana's Nuh district has been arrested for allegedly demanding sexual favours from a physically-challenged woman. The SI contacted the woman following an FIR she had registered against her in-laws at Firozpur Jhirka Police Station. The woman alleged the accused demanded sexual favours and threatened to harm her case if his demands were not met.

296.title: Chhattisgarh govt inviting bids to lease out 24 tourism properties
296.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government is inviting bids from "experienced private investors" to lease out 24 state-owned motels and resorts for 30 years. The bids are open till September 5 for 14 non-functional and 10 functional properties under the Chhattisgarh Tourism Board. The initiative is expected to provide facilities to local and foreign tourists and raise employment opportunities, officials said.

297.title: Palestinian shot dead by Israeli forces during raid in West Bank
297.article_body: A 58-year-old man was shot dead by Israeli forces during an arrest raid in the West Bank on Friday, according to the deceased's brother. The raid was aimed at arresting Palestinians suspected of taking part in or planning attacks, the Israeli military said. The military said that its troops shot back after Palestinians opened fire and hurled firebombs at them.

298.title: Looking forward to making India proud again: CWG 2022 gold medallist Sreeja
298.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula, who won a gold medal along with her partner Sharath Kamal in mixed doubles event at the recently concluded Commonwealth Games 2022, said she is looking forward to making her nation proud again. Sreeja and Sharath became the first Indian pair to win gold in mixed doubles in the history of the Commonwealth Games.

299.title: Prefer to play Man Utd after they win 5-0: Liverpool coach Klopp
299.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said he would prefer to play against Manchester United if the Red Devils had won their last match 5-0. Klopp said he was wary of a strong comeback from United who had lost their previous match against Brentford 0-4. Liverpool themselves are yet to win their first match of the season after playing two back-to-back draws.

300.title: BJP chief JP Nadda to visit poll-bound Himachal Pradesh
300.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda is set to visit the poll-bound state of Himachal Pradesh and attend various events in Sirmaur on Saturday. He is expected to hold meetings with the leaders of the state unit to deliberate on the strategy for the upcoming Assembly elections. The BJP chief will also be addressing a public meeting in Paonta Sahib.

301.title: Officials give tennis player Bouchard credential with swimsuit pic, change it later
301.article_body: The officials at Odlum Brown VanOpen tournament gave Canadian tennis player Eugenie Bouchard credential with a swimsuit picture of the player. Bouchard took to Instagram Stories to share a picture of the credential, writing, "Can someone from @vanopentennis credential office explain pls??" Hours later, she shared another picture of the credential with her headshot and wrote, "Got a real one."

302.title: Captain Zoya becomes 1st Indian female pilot to be added to US Aviation Museum
302.article_body: Air India's Captain Zoya Agarwal has become the first Indian female pilot to be added to SFO Aviation Museum in the US. She was the first Indian woman pilot to fly an aircraft above the North pole covering a record-breaking distance of around 16,000 km. "I was amazed to see that I’m the only living object over there," said Agarwal

303.title: Sleeping pods for passengers inaugurated at Chennai airport, pics surface
303.article_body: A 'sleeping pod facility', with four bed-sized capsules, was inaugurated at Chennai airport. The 'Sleepzo' facility is located in the arrivals section of domestic terminal, near baggage belt number 1. "The facility can be availed on...hourly basis and has amenities like reading lights, charging stations, USB charger, luggage space, ambient lights, blower control," said Airports Authority of India.

304.title: Which 4 cricketers have taken 100 or more wickets on a single ground?
304.article_body: England's Stuart Broad has become the fourth cricketer after Muttiah Muralitharan, James Anderson and Rangana Herath to take 100 wickets on a single ground. With his three wickets in the Test against South Africa, the 36-year-old took his Test wicket tally at Lord's to 102. Muralitharan is the only cricketer to take 100-plus Test wickets at three separate stadiums each.

305.title: 'India, China must work together for Asian century,' says Jaishankar; China reacts
305.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar recently quoted Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping's remarks on India and China, saying, "The Asian century will be difficult to happen if India and China don't come together." Chinese Foreign Ministry backed his remarks, saying China and India have "far more common interests than differences". Jaishankar also said Indo-China relations were in a "difficult phase".

306.title: Islamic State cell member sentenced to life in prison in US for beheadings
306.article_body: A member of an Islamic State cell found guilty in April for his role in hostage-taking plot that led to beheadings of American journalists and aid workers was sentenced to life in prison by a US court. El Shafee Elsheikh was sentenced in Virginia. The ex-British citizen was found guilty of charges including lethal hostage-taking and conspiracy to commit murder.

307.title: Revenue of Indian Railways increased after I played Geet, jokes Kareena
307.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor, during her appearance in the courtroom comedy 'Case Toh Banta Hai', joked that the revenue of Indian Railways increased after the release of her film 'Jab We Met'. "After I played Geet, the sale of harem pants and revenues of Indian Railways both have increased by the way," she said. 'Jab We Met' was released in 2007.

308.title: Fishing trawler capsizes in Bay of Bengal, 5 missing
308.article_body: Five people went missing after a fishing trawler capsized in the Bay of Bengal on Friday, an official of a fishermen's association said. The boat, which had 18 people onboard, capsized near the Kendo island of West Bengal, which marks the end of Sundarbans territory. The 13 rescued fishermen were taken to a hospital in Kakdwip.

309.title: Don't step out: Odisha CM's appeal to 4 districts amid heavy rainfall warning
309.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik appealed to people of four districts including Balasore, Keonjhar, Mayurbhanj and Bhadrak not to venture out of their homes on Saturday amid heavy rainfall forecast. "I appeal to people not to panic but rather follow the instructions of the administration," Patnaik said. The IMD has issued red alert in the four districts for Saturday morning.

310.title: N'Golo Kante out injured for few weeks: Chelsea manager Tuchel
310.article_body: Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said midfielder N'Golo Kante will be sidelined for a few weeks after picking up a hamstring injury during their match against Tottenham Hotspur. "We're talking weeks, which is not good news. We're disappointed and sad," said Tuchel. He added that striker Armando Broja and midfielder Mateo Kovacic are also injured for their next match against Leeds.

311.title: Such incidents keep happening: SBSP chief after girl stripped in UP
311.article_body: SBSP chief OP Rajbhar drew criticism for saying "such incidents keep happening" after a video of a girl being stripped by six men went viral. "The population of UP is 25 crore...there's not enough police to guard every house," he said. The girl and her male friend were reportedly thrashed while they were sitting together in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur.

312.title: Next state budget to be dedicated to youth, students: Raj CM Gehlot
312.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday said the state's next budget will be dedicated to the youth, students and over one crore women will be given smartphones. The Gehlot government will be presenting its last budget in 2023. He appealed to the youth and students to give suggestions and said their views will be included in the budget announcements.

313.title: BSF head constable killed in attack by insurgents in Tripura
313.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) head constable, Girjesh Kumar Uddey, was killed in Tripura on Friday after indiscriminate firing by suspected insurgents, officials said. It is believed that some shots were also fired from across the Bangladesh border, officials added. "Uddey was immediately evacuated by helicopter to Agartala, where he later succumbed to the grievous injuries," BSF officials said.

314.title: Madhavan visits India's 1st indigenous aircraft carrier Vikrant, shares pics
314.article_body: Actor R Madhavan took to Instagram to share some pictures from his visit to India's first indigenous aircraft carrier Vikrant. "My utmost gratitude and thank you for this very special honour. Such a privilege to be invited by the #indiannavy on the indigenously built aircraft carrier soon to be commissioned," he wrote. Recently, actor Mohanlal also visited IAC Vikrant.

315.title: Salute to Dhawan, Pujara for their drive and passion: Kaif
315.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has spoken about Indian batters Shikhar Dhawan and Cheteshwar Pujara. "A salute to Dhawan and Pujara for their drive and passion," Kaif said. The former India U-19 World Cup winning captain added, "No negativity, no complaint, if I have a bat in hand I will score, that's pure love for the game."

316.title: India has been incredibly kind to me: AB de Villiers
316.article_body: After collaborating with an Indian NGO to guide underprivileged children, former South Africa skipper AB de Villiers said that "India has been incredibly kind" to him over the years. "I am always looking for ways to give something back [to India]. I am happy to be associated with MAD (Make A Difference)...Their work is incredible," De Villiers said.

317.title: She's studying overseas: Ajay on daughter's rumoured acting debut
317.article_body: Amid rumours about Nysa Devgn making her Bollywood debut, Ajay Devgn said that his 19-year-old daughter hasn't made up her mind yet. "She's just a teenager. She hasn't told [us] what her...career choice would be. As of now, she's studying overseas," he added. "If she decides to pursue a career in the film industry, it'll be her choice," said Ajay.

318.title: Aaliyah got anxiety after rape threats, I dropped everything & ran to US: Anurag
318.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap revealed that his daughter Aaliyah Kashyap started suffering from anxiety after getting threats on social media. Aaliyah also got rape threats after she posted pictures in lingerie. Anurag recalled that he dropped everything and ran to the US to be with his daughter. "She really is out there expressing herself but her anxiety bothers me," said Anurag.

319.title: Top win: Ian Bishop on SA's an innings and 12-run win vs England in 1st Test
319.article_body: Following South Africa's an innings and 12-run win against England in first Test at Lord's, Ian Bishop took to Twitter and wrote, "Top win for South Africa." Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "South Africa shows that Bazball doesn't work against a world class bowling attack with variety and a sharp captain who sets smart fields." South Africa lead the three-match series 1-0.

320.title: Lalu's son-in-law running govt: BJP MP on his pics at Bihar govt meetings
320.article_body: Pictures showing RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav's son-in-law, Shailesh Kumar, at Bihar government's official meetings have emerged on social media. Reacting to this, BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sushil Kumar Modi said Lalu's son-in-law and party workers are running the government and Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is "helpless". Modi said Shailesh had no business being present at the meetings.

321.title: Army defuses unexploded ordnance shell in J&K's Samba district
321.article_body: An unexploded ordnance was detected and defused by Indian Army on Friday in Jammu & Kashmir's Samba district, officials said. Personnel of the Tiger division assisted civilian administration in safely extricating the live ordnance shell from a heavily populated area, officials added. According to officials, the shell was found near Kikri Morh in Balole Nala of Samba.

322.title: Jharkhand CM lays foundation stone for 3 projects worth ₹666 cr in Ranchi
322.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren laid foundation stones for three road projects worth around ₹666 crore in Ranchi on Friday. "The state government has been working to strengthen road infrastructure and make it convenient for common people," Soren said. The road construction department claimed the state will witness road network projects worth ₹35,000 to ₹40,000 crore in two to three years.

323.title: Speculation of joining Cong is fake news: Shivpal Yadav
323.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia President Shivpal Singh Yadav has termed the speculations of him joining the Congress party as "fake news". The Uttar Pradesh MLA said that he is trying to unite the Opposition for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "When we were not considered as an alliance partner, we parted ways," Shivpal said about his party's alliance with SP.

324.title: New York Times denies BJP's claims that its Delhi schools report is 'paid news'
324.article_body: The New York Times (NYT) has responded after BJP called the US newspaper's report on Delhi schools and education system a "paid promotion". "Our report about Delhi's education system is based on impartial, on-ground reporting," said the NYT, adding, "[Our] journalism...is independent, free from political or advertiser influence." Delhi CM had earlier held a press conference over the report.

325.title: Scientists develop new simple method to destroy 'forever chemicals'
325.article_body: Scientists have developed a new method to destroy 'forever chemicals', using relatively low temperatures and common reagents, that capitalises on the 'Achilles' heel' of PFAS. They heated these chemicals in the solvent dimethyl sulfoxide and found that it "decapitated" a section of the molecule and left behind the "safest form of fluorine". PFAS causes cancer and other diseases in humans.

326.title: How does the latest World Test Championship points table read?
326.article_body: After defeating England by an innings and 12 runs at Lord's, South Africa have consolidated their position on the top of the World Test Championship points table. South Africa are placed first with 75% of points won, while England are seventh on the table with 31.37% of points won. India are placed fourth on the table, while Pakistan are fifth.

327.title: India Women announces squads for England tour, Jhulan returns for ODIs
327.article_body: India Women squads for the upcoming tour of England have been announced. Pacer Jhulan Goswami, who last played for India in March 2022, has been included in the ODI squad. Kiran Navgire, who plays for Nagaland, received her maiden call-up to India's T20I squad. India will play three T20Is beginning September 10, and three ODIs starting September 18.

328.title: Wildfire in eastern Spain is out of control: Authorities
328.article_body: Authorities in eastern Spain on Friday said a wildfire is out of control and 35 aircraft are fighting the blaze which has entered its fifth day. The fire has already scorched 19,000 hectares of forest land. Despite a bout of rainfall on Thursday, strong winds made the fire "very aggressive", the Valencia regional government said.

329.title: Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla's term extended till Aug 22, 2023
329.article_body: The central government on Friday extended for the third time the service tenure of Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla for another year, up to August 22, 2023, according to a Personnel Ministry order. Bhalla, a 1984-batch Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer of the Assam-Meghalaya cadre, assumed the office on August 23, 2019.

330.title: Kerala is not Russia under Stalin: Cong's Satheesan to CM Vijayan
330.article_body: Kerala's Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan has criticised the state police's move to banish Farzeen Majeed, a Youth Congress worker, from Kannur district under the Kerala Anti-social Activities (Prevention) Act. "CM Pinarayi Vijayan should bear in mind that this is not Russia under Stalin...Of the 19 cases against [Majeed]...12 are related to...violating the Covid-19 protocol," he said.

331.title: WHO recommends 2 monoclonal antibody treatments for Ebola
331.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has recommended two existing treatments for the Ebola virus, saying they significantly reduce the number of deaths. The WHO said monoclonal antibodies Ebanga (mAb114) and Inmazeb (REGN-EB3) have "revolutionised" the treatment for the disease. The treatments are appropriate for pregnant and breastfeeding persons, old people, children and newborns, the WHO said.

332.title: H'yana appoints retired HC judge to probe killing of DSP in Nuh
332.article_body: The Haryana government on Thursday appointed a single-member inquiry commission to investigate the killing of DSP Surender Singh who was allegedly mowed down by a dumper truck during a raid against illegal mining in Nuh. The commission consists of retired Punjab and Haryana HC judge LN Mittal. The commission has been asked to submit its report within a month.

333.title: No reward bigger than this: Kartik as street vendor praises 'Bhool...'
333.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to share a video showing him interacting with a young street vendor. In the video, the boy could be seen telling Kartik how much he loved 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. He also did the signature step of the film before asking the actor for a selfie. "No reward bigger than this," Kartik captioned the video.

334.title: We wanted a podium finish at CWG after a bad hockey WC campaign: Salima Tete
334.article_body: Indian women's hockey team midfielder Salima Tete revealed that a podium finish was the only target that her side had at recently concluded CWG 2022 after a "bad" campaign at hockey World Cup. "Kuch na kuch karna hi hai (needed to do something)," she added. India won a bronze medal after beating New Zealand 2-1 in penalty shootout in Birmingham.

335.title: Trial courts should ensure cases are not prolonged: Supreme Court
335.article_body: The Supreme Court said the trial courts should ensure cases are not prolonged, as delays lead to problems in witness statements. The court made the observations as it granted bail to a man who is accused of helping the murderers of the Mayor of Chittor, Andhra Pradesh escape. The man was in jail for seven years but witnesses weren't examined.

336.title: Indian para javelin thrower Sumit Antil breaks his own world record
336.article_body: India's 24-year-old javelin thrower Sumit Antil on Friday broke his own world record at Indian Open National Para Athletics Championships 2022. Sumit set the new world record in F64 category with a best throw of 68.62 metres. Antil had set the previous world record (68.55 metres) at Tokyo Paralympics. He had broken world record thrice to win gold at Paralympics.

337.title: Manoj Tiwari calls for money laundering probe against Delhi Dy CM
337.article_body: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari has called for a money laundering probe against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, who the CBI raided over alleged irregularities in the Delhi excise policy introduced last year. Tiwari said probe agencies should inquire whether the AAP has converted black money in Delhi and other states. The MP demanded that Sisodia should resign over the allegations.

338.title: You have same rights as me: Bangladesh PM to Hindus on Janmashtami
338.article_body: Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said Hindu people in the country have the same rights as she has. Hasina was interacting with Hindu community leaders on the occasion of Janmashtami when she made the remarks. "Please don’t undermine yourselves (Hindus). You were born in this country, you are the citizens of this country,” she said.

339.title: Hope Dobaaraa goes for Oscars: Agnihotri on Kashyap's remark on Kashmir Files
339.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri said in an interview that he hopes people go and watch Anurag Kashyap's 'Dobaaraa', and make it more successful than 'The Kashmir Files'. "Hope it (Dobaaraa) goes for the Oscars," he added. Agnihotri was reacting to Kashyap's recent remark wherein he said he hopes the former's 'The Kashmir Files' is not India's official entry for Oscars.

340.title: Lab report shared by TDP on Andhra MP's 'nude' clip not original: CID
340.article_body: Karnataka CID has refuted Telugu Desam Party's claim that a US lab has certified that Andhra Pradesh MP Gorantla Madhav's alleged nude video was genuine. CID ADG Sunil Kumar said the certificate shared by TDP leaders wasn't original. Kumar claimed a lab official said it's suspected that the video, purportedly showing a nude Madhav attending a video call, was morphed.

341.title: 10 students critically injured as lightning strikes Odisha school
341.article_body: At least 10 students of a primary school in Odisha's Deogarh district were critically injured after they were struck by lightning on Friday afternoon. Officials said 17 students were present in class when the incident took place. As per reports, the impact of the lightning left a hole in the roof, while the floor of the classroom cracked.

342.title: Police stop PDP rally against voting rights for J&K 'non-locals'
342.article_body: Leaders of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) were stopped by the police from protesting against electoral changes in Jammu and Kashmir allowing "non-locals" to vote. "Outsiders living temporarily...are being given voting rights, which is an attack on our identity and rights," said a PDP leader. The party was trying to take out a rally from Residency Road to Lal Chowk.

343.title: 14 including 5 children killed in rocket attack in northern Syria
343.article_body: At least 14 people were killed and 30 others were injured in a rocket attack on a market in northern Syria's Al-Bab on Friday, emergency responders working in the rebel-held areas informed. Five of those who lost their lives were children, rescue group White Helmets said. Al-Bab falls within the areas of Syria controlled by Turkish-backed armed opposition groups.

344.title: 11 civilians stranded on island formed in stream rescued in Himachal
344.article_body: The Army, National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel and Himachal Pradesh Police's Quick Response Team on Friday rescued 11 civilians, who were stranded on an island formed in the middle of the fast-flowing Ghumarnu stream in Kangra. Earlier, the Kangra District Emergency Operations Centre had reported that the civilians were stuck due to a sudden increase in water levels.

345.title: Bee attacks Ishan Kishan during National Anthem, his reaction goes viral
345.article_body: A video went viral showing Ishan Kishan being attacked by a bee during National Anthem ahead of the first ODI against Zimbabwe. In the video, Ishan can be seen stunned after the bee attacks him. He can then be seen ducking before it flies away. "Similar things used to happen to me during prayer in school days," a fan tweeted.

346.title: Indian origin scientist joins NASA's Artemis I mission to the moon
346.article_body: Amit Pandey, who hails from Uttarakhand, is all set to join NASA's new moon programme Artemis I as a senior scientist. "NASA is currently undertaking a long-term lunar programme to enable astronauts to live and conduct research on the moon," Pandey, who works at Lockheed Martin, NASA's contractor for this mission, said in an interview with ETV Bharat.

347.title: Reuse, recycle water to become 'Aatmanirbhar': Shekhawat
