347.article_body: Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Friday said there is a need to reuse and recycle water in order to become "Aatmanirbhar" or self-sufficient in its supply. Speaking at the 'Har Ghar Jal Utsav' programme, Shekhawat also called for harvesting rainwater. 'Har Ghar Jal' programme will touch the lives of common people in the country, Shekhawat added.

348.title: 8 Kuki Tribal Union militants surrender in Assam's Haflong
348.article_body: At least eight militants of the Kuki Tribal Union (KTU) surrendered before security forces in Assam's Haflong on Friday, an official said. The group is mainly active in Kuki-dominated areas of Nagaland and Manipur, Dima Hasao and Karbi Anglong in Assam. It took us three months to convince them to surrender after their activities came to light, the official added.

349.title: Had night terrors after facing 'witch trial': Teacher forced to resign over bikini pics
349.article_body: The St Xavier's University, Kolkata professor, who was allegedly forced to resign over her private bikini pictures posted on Instagram, recounted her meeting with the Vice-Chancellor before she stepped down. She said it was a "witch trial" where she was "slut-shamed". "For many days after this episode, I was nauseous, unable to eat properly, visited by night terrors," she said.

350.title: Ambedkar's statue found damaged in UP's Sitapur
350.article_body: A statue of social reformer BR Ambedkar was found damaged in the Rikhipurwa village of UP's Sitapur district. The police have lodged a case against the unidentified suspects who had absconded after vandalising the statue in the early hours of Friday, police said. Notably, the district officials have assured the locals of their support in replacing the damaged statue.

351.title: Fire in sugar refinery kills 2 workers, injures 9 in Andhra Pradesh
351.article_body: Two workers were killed and nine others were injured in a fire that broke out at a sugar refinery near Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada on Friday afternoon. Police said that preliminary investigation revealed that an electrical short circuit might have triggered the fire at the conveyor belt in the unit. The injured persons were being treated in different hospitals, police added.

352.title: Bhagat enters singles, doubles finals at Thailand Para Badminton International
352.article_body: Indian shuttler Pramod Bhagat entered the finals of both men's singles and doubles at Thailand Para Badminton International 2022 tournament in Pattaya. Pramod defeated compatriot Kumar Nitesh 21-12, 21-18 in the men's singles. Bhagat along with his partner Sukant Kadam beat the Indian pair of Mohammad Arwaz Ansari and Deep Ranjan Bisoyee 21-10, 14-21, 21-14 in the men's doubles.

353.title: 14 fraud cases detected during Hisar's Agnipath recruitment drive
353.article_body: During the Agniveer recruitment rally in Haryana's Hisar, 14 aspirants were found to have allegedly used fake documents. "These cases are being caught due to strict vigilance and transparency in the recruitment process," said an official statement. The candidates allegedly used fake or tampered admit cards. The drive, under the Agnipath scheme, started on August 12.

354.title: Foreign engagement will be in line with Sharia: Taliban leader
354.article_body: Taliban's supreme spiritual leader Haibatullah Akhundzada on Thursday said that Afghanistan under Taliban will engage with the international community in accordance with Sharia law, media reports citing Afghanistan's information ministry said. "If Sharia doesn't allow it, we will not deal with any other country," he added. No country has formally recognised Taliban's rule in Afghanistan yet.

355.title: Not one asteroid but asteroid bombardment killed dinosaurs on Earth: Study
355.article_body: Not one asteroid but an asteroid bombardment on Earth might have killed dinosaurs, a new study has found. Previously, it was believed that a 10-kilometre-wide Chicxulub asteroid that struck Earth killed dinosaurs. But researchers have discovered an 8-kilometre-wide asteroid impact crater underneath North Atlantic Ocean, estimated to be 66 million years old, around the time of dinosaur extinction.

356.title: Ranbir Kapoor jokes about pregnant Alia Bhatt's weight in live video, fans react
356.article_body: During a live interaction on Thursday to promote their upcoming film 'Brahmāstra', Ranbir Kapoor joked about his pregnant wife, actress Alia Bhatt's weight gain. "Well, I can see somebody has phailoed (spread out)," he said while adding it's a joke. While some fans called it "distasteful", another fan wrote, "That was a disgusting joke to say to a pregnant woman."

357.title: You are affecting thousands of families: Vijay on 'Boycott Laal...' trend
357.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda, reacting to the social media trend demanding a boycott of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said it doesn't only affect Aamir Khan but several others who are associated with the making of the film. "When Aamir sir makes a Laal Singh Chaddha...there are 2000-3000 families that are being provided for," he said, adding, "Please realise you're not affecting Aamir...alone but...economy."

358.title: 20-year-old Manisha Kalyan becomes 1st Indian to play in UEFA Women's Champions League
358.article_body: Forward Manisha Kalyan has become the first Indian footballer to play in the UEFA Women's Champions League. The 20-year-old achieved the feat by making her debut for Cypriot club Apollon Ladies against SFK Riga in the European club competition. Manisha came on as a substitute after 60 minutes in the match. Apollon Ladies FC won the match 3-0.

359.title: England's Barmy Army trolled for '1,000 days' tweet on Virat Kohli's century drought
359.article_body: England's Barmy Army today tweeted, "1,000 days," seemingly in reference to Virat Kohli not having scored an international hundred for 1,000 days. Indian fans trolled Barmy Army, with one writing, "3,532 days since England last won any format series against India in India." Another wrote, "Jason Roy + Bairstow + Buttler + Stokes = 59 international centuries...Kohli = 70 centuries."

360.title: China sentences Chinese-Canadian tycoon Xiao to 13 yrs in jail, fines his firm ₹64,500 cr
360.article_body: A Shanghai court has sentenced Chinese-Canadian billionaire Xiao Jianhua to 13 years in jail and fined his Tomorrow Holdings conglomerate 55.03 billion yuan (over ₹64,500 crore). Xiao and Tomorrow Holdings were charged with illegally siphoning away public deposits, betraying the use of entrusted property, and the illegal use of funds and bribery. Xiao hasn't been seen in public since 2017.

361.title: Geomagnetic storm creates aurora borealis in parts of US
361.article_body: As the sun is in its solar maxima, it has been erupting frequently and causing solar storms. One such geomagnetic storm that occurred on Thursday created a colourful aurora borealis that appeared in parts of the US. An aurora occurs when solar particles from the storm collide with the Earth's atmosphere. The next aurora will reportedly occur on September 23.

362.title: Nitish as Oppn's PM candidate an option if other parties want: JD(U) chief
362.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar as the Opposition's prime ministerial candidate is an option "if other parties want so", Janata Dal (United) chief Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh said on Friday. "Nitish Kumar will work on bringing all other parties fighting the BJP on one platform to pose a united challenge to its rule," Singh added.

363.title: Centre scared as Kejriwal an alternative to PM Modi: Raghav Chadha
363.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha said the Centre has "unleashed agencies such as the Central Bureau of Investigation" to "finish" party chief Arvind Kejriwal. Chadha said the BJP is "scared" of Kejriwal as he has emerged as an "alternative to PM Narendra Modi". On Friday, the agency raided Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence over alleged irregularities in Delhi's excise policy.

364.title: PETA writes to Indian Matchmaking's Sima after complaints about use of animals on show
364.article_body: PETA India wrote a letter to Sima Taparia and urged her to avoid using elephants and horses for future seasons of 'Indian Matchmaking' after receiving several complaints. It said animals are "not a good match" for wedding festivities because of the loud music, crowds and firecrackers. The letter elaborated on the atrocities animals often face when used for wedding processions.

365.title: Kejriwal govt looted Delhiites in name of liquor: BJP's Harsh Vardhan
365.article_body: Calling it the "most corrupt" government, BJP leader Harsh Vardhan accused Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP of looting people in the name of liquor in Delhi. "The corrupt, dishonest and liar Kejriwal government has no right to stay in governance," he said. "Kejriwal...has pushed the women and youth of the national capital to intoxication for his own selfish deeds," he added.

366.title: Fed up with her demand to get married, journalist kills lover in Maha; arrested
366.article_body: A 35-year-old journalist was arrested in Maharashtra's Aurangabad for allegedly killing a 24-year-old married woman with whom he was in a relationship and hacking her body into pieces. The woman had left her family and was living in a rented house. According to the police, the accused killed her as he was fed up with her demand to get married.

367.title: Bengaluru couple, their 9-year-old son found dead in apartment
367.article_body: A couple and their nine-year-old son were found dead in their apartment in Bengaluru on Thursday. The incident came to light when the family's relatives tried to contact them, but received no response, police said. Police suspect the man killed his wife and son first and later took his own life. The deceased's bodies have been sent for postmortem.

368.title: Student's suicide bid leads to fire at Hyd college; principal injured
368.article_body: A student leader threatened to set himself ablaze after pouring petrol on himself and the principal of Hyderabad's Narayana college on Friday. This resulted in an accidental fire which injured him, the principal and another college employee. The leader was arguing with the principal over the non-issuance of Transfer Certificate of a student reportedly due to unpaid fee worth ₹16,000.

369.title: Mangaluru civic body removes banner with pictures of Savarkar, Godse
369.article_body: A banner extending greetings on the occasion of the Janmashtami festival in Mangaluru's Surathkal area stirred controversy as it had pictures of Hindutva icon VD Savarkar and Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse. The banner, which was installed by a local Hindu Mahasabha leader Rajesh Pavitran, was later removed by the Mangaluru City Corporation after a complaint was received.

370.title: Open to feedback from citizens, activists: New PCMC chief
370.article_body: IIT Guwahati alumnus Shekhar Singh, who has taken charge as the new Commissioner of Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC), said he will be open to feedback and suggestions from citizens and activists. Singh has earlier served as District Collector of Satara and Gadchiroli. "My focus will be on major infrastructural projects, education and health," he said.

371.title: Delhi Dy CM listed as Number 1 among 15 accused in CBI's excise scam FIR
371.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has named 15 accused, including Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, in its FIR over the Centre's allegations of corruption in the liquor policy. The agency raided at least 21 locations on Friday, including Sisodia's residence. "It is very unfortunate that those who do good work in our country are harassed like this," Sisodia tweeted.

372.title: Noida Police attach illegal assets worth ₹5.5 cr of 2 gangsters
372.article_body: Police in Gautam Buddha Nagar have attached "illegally-acquired" assets of two gangsters worth around ₹5.50 crore, officials said on Friday. The attached properties include one plot in Meerut, two in Noida and one four-wheeler and one two-wheeler. The alleged gangsters were identified as Sanjay Goyal and Sudesh Kumar.

373.title: Bhaichung Bhutia files nomination for AIFF President's post
373.article_body: Former Indian men's football team captain Bhaichung Bhutia has filed his nomination for President's post in the upcoming AIFF elections. "In the wake of the Supreme Court decision to allow players I hope players can have a chance to serve Indian football. We want to show we can be good not only as players but also as administrators," Bhutia said.

374.title: KKR CEO's conversation with Irfan after appointment of Pandit as head coach goes viral
374.article_body: KKR CEO Venky Mysore's conversation with Irfan Pathan on Twitter after appointment of Chandrakant Pandit as head coach went viral. Responding to Irfan's old tweet wherein he suggested that Pandit should get a good IPL contract, Venky wrote, "We were listening to you Irfan bhai." Irfan replied, "Haha...Venky bhai...Wishing you and Chandu bhai all the luck...Sending you my bank details."

375.title: Which 13 states have been barred from buying, selling electricity on power exchanges?
375.article_body: A total of 13 states/UTs have been barred from buying or selling electricity from spot market for not clearing pending payments of ₹5,085 crore to power generators. They are Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Madhya Pradesh, Manipur, Mizoram, Jharkhand, Bihar, J&K, Rajasthan, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Chhattisgarh. Telangana was listed as the highest defaulter with dues worth ₹1,381 crore.

376.title: Citigroup fined $15 million by UK's financial regulator for market abuse rule failings
376.article_body: New York-headquartered Citigroup has been fined $15 million by the UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) for failing to adequately monitor and report suspicious activity in financial markets for years. Citigroup's London-based trading arm didn't "properly" implement Market Abuse Regulation (MAR) trade surveillance requirements from when they were introduced in 2016 until early 2018, the FCA said.

377.title: We want to become India's electronic hub: T'gana Minister KTR
377.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Friday said the state wants to become India's electronic hub. "We are also a major player in Information Technology, hosting Microsoft's largest office outside of the US," KTR said. "The largest US FDA approved units outside of America are in Telangana which makes the state India's pharmaceutical hub," KTR further said.

378.title: Bihar CM's helicopter makes emergency landing in Gaya due to rain
378.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's helicopter on Friday made an emergency landing in Gaya due to bad weather conditions. The JD(U) chief had gone on an aerial survey of drought-hit districts including Gaya and Aurangabad on Friday morning. "The [helicopter] encountered en-route cloud on return as it was raining in Patna. We diverted it to Gaya," an airport official said.

379.title: Anurag would start 'Dobaaraa' shoot by hugging people: Vidusshi
379.article_body: Actress Vidusshi Mehra has said filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, with whom she worked in the film 'Dobaaraa', would start the shooting by hugging people. She added that at the film's premiere, Anurag hugged each member of the cast and crew, including spot boys and technicians. "It...sets a benchmark of kindness and respect that sometimes goes missing in the industry," Vidusshi said.

380.title: I'd like to see India batting first: Maninder ahead of second ODI in Harare
380.article_body: Ahead of India-Zimbabwe second ODI, Maninder Singh said he'd like to see India batting first as playing in difficult conditions will be a test in Harare. India won the toss and opted to bowl first in their 10-wicket win in first ODI on Thursday. "We saw in...later overs when the surface dried up, it became good for batting," he added.

381.title: 4 arrested for running sex racket from Gurugram spa in mall
381.article_body: Police have arrested four people, including two women, for allegedly running a sex racket from a spa in Gurugram. The spa is located in Ocus Quantum Mall in Sector 51, officials said, adding that its owner Bhagat Singh and manager Yogesh were arrested. Preliminary investigation revealed the owner pushed the women into prostitution and charged ₹2,000 per customer.

382.title: Assistant Engineer arrested while taking bribe of ₹29,000 in T'gana
382.article_body: The Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested an Assistant Engineer of Telangana State Southern Power Distribution Company Limited (TSSPDCL) for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹29,000 from a private contractor, an official statement said. The accused, Baisu Govinda Raju, allegedly demanded the bribe from the contractor for preparing and forwarding the bills pertaining to the works executed by him.

383.title: 'Whale vomit' worth ₹1.6 crore seized in Thane, 2 arrested
383.article_body: Two people were arrested and 0.750-gm ambergris or 'whale vomit' worth ₹1.6 crore was seized from them in Thane's Dombivli, police said on Friday. They were intercepted after police laid a trap near a hotel on Wednesday following a tip-off, an official said. They've been charged under Wild Life (Protection) Act. Sale or possession of ambergris is prohibited in India.

384.title: Men impersonating Mumbai policemen cheat Delhi senior citizen of ₹18 lakh
384.article_body: A senior citizen in Delhi's Dwarka was allegedly cheated of ₹18 lakh by men claiming to be Mumbai Police officers. The victim claimed the accused told him to pay the money on the grounds that a woman, who had earlier made an obscene call to him, had died by suicide. He approached cyber police after realising he was being defrauded.

385.title: Jimmy Fallon & Demi Lovato dance to 'Kala Chashma', Sidharth reacts
385.article_body: 'The Tonight Show' host Jimmy Fallon and singer Demi Lovato danced to 'Kala Chashma', a video of which was shared by the singer on her Instagram handle. Sidharth Malhotra, who featured in the song with Katrina Kaif, reacted to the video on Twitter, writing, "Happy to see @jimmyfallon & @ddlovato grooving on #KalaChashma. Thank you for the love."

386.title: Auto driver arrested for killing sex worker for money in Bengaluru
386.article_body: An autorickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly killing a female sex worker near Madiwala Lake in Bengaluru last week. The auto driver, Imran (28), killed the victim, Suraya (38), and robbed her of cash and other valuables after having sex with her, police said. Notably, Suraya had hired Imran's autorickshaw for three consecutive nights starting from August 8, police added.

387.title: Woman arrested from Delhi's Majnu ka Tilla with 1.25 kg ganja
387.article_body: A 46-year-old woman was arrested from Delhi's Majnu ka Tilla area for allegedly peddling drugs, police informed on Friday. The accused, Sunita, was found in possession of 1.25 kg of ganja. Police said that she was seen making suspicious movements in Aruna Nagar on Wednesday. She was chased down by police after a brief pursuit, a police official informed.

388.title: UN peacekeeping mission pulls out of major city in Congo
388.article_body: The UN peacekeeping mission in Congo has withdrawn its personnel out of Butembo city following recent violent protests against the mission's alleged failure to protect civilians, UN and Congolese officials said on Thursday. The mission's spokeswoman, however, said "the mission has proceeded to a temporary redeployment of its personnel outside Butembo". She did not specify when they might return.

389.title: Gandhiji's statue at temple in US vandalised twice in 2 weeks, police share pic
389.article_body: A Mahatma Gandhi statue at a temple in New York's Queens was destroyed by a sledgehammer on Tuesday, in the second attack on it in two weeks. The statue outside the Shri Tulsi Mandir was reportedly smashed to pieces, defaced with obscenities and toppled over. Police shared the statue's pictures saying both incidents are being investigated as possible hate crimes.

390.title: BJP MLA Raja Singh tries to burn Munawar Faruqui's set in Hyd; stopped
390.article_body: Goshamahal BJP MLA Raja Singh, who was reportedly on his way to burn down the set at Shilpakala Vedika where standup comedian Munawar Faruqui is slated to perform on Saturday, was taken into preventive custody on Friday. Singh also told the media that his supporters have bought tickets to Faruqui's show and will try their best to stop the programme.

391.title: Unseeded Keys beats world no. 1 Swiatek to reach Cincinnati Open quarters
391.article_body: Unseeded Madison Keys defeated world number one Iga Swiatek 6-3, 6-4 to enter the quarter-final at Cincinnati Open on Thursday. "It feels great...I think I am playing some pretty good tennis," said Keys. It was Keys' first win in six matches against the top seed. The 2019 Cincinnati Open champion will face Wimbledon champion Elena Rybakina in the quarter-final.

392.title: Our presence guarantees no 'Chernobyl scenario' in Zaporizhzhia: Russia
392.article_body: Russia's Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov on Friday said that the presence of Russian forces at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant guarantees that the plant does not witness a "Chernobyl scenario". On Thursday, the ministry had termed the UN proposal to demilitarise the area around the plant as "unacceptable". The plant has come under shelling several times in recent weeks.

393.title: 6 held after 83-year-old B'luru woman killed, robbed of ₹2 lakh cash
393.article_body: Six men of Nepali origin have been arrested after an 83-year-old woman was robbed and killed at her home in Bengaluru, police said. Five men were directly involved in the crime. The sixth provided information about the woman. Jewellery, gold and ₹2.4 lakh in cash were stolen from the house. The culprits include men involved in multiple robberies in Bengaluru.

394.title: Chennai woman finds worm crawling in her food; eatery faces temporary ban
394.article_body: A woman, who ordered 'Chhola Puri' at 'Namma Vidya Vasantha Bhavan' restaurant at a mall in Chennai, allegedly found a worm crawling in her food. She filed a complaint with the food safety department, following which they conducted an inspection and imposed a temporary ban on the restaurant. A warning regarding food safety measures was issued to the restaurant owner.

395.title: 'Jungle raj' prevails in Uttar Pradesh: BSP chief Mayawati
395.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Friday criticised the BJP government in Uttar Pradesh and alleged that "jungle raj" prevailed in the state. "Overall, lack of judicious use of law in Uttar Pradesh, fearlessness among criminal elements are proof of poor law and order," Mayawati tweeted. "There is extreme poverty and unemployment in all parts of UP," she added.

396.title: List shows states/UTs where women tend to have more sexual partners than men
396.article_body: Women on average have more sexual partners than men in 11 states and UTs, according to data by National Family Health Survey. These states and UTs are Rajasthan, Haryana, Chandigarh, Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Madhya Pradesh, Assam, Kerala, Lakshadweep, Puducherry and Tamil Nadu. The survey was conducted among 1.1 lakh women and 1 lakh men.

397.title: Pune Metro to finalise DPR for 82-km route by August end
397.article_body: Pune Metro rail will finalise by August-end the detailed project report (DPR) for the proposed 82.5-km route which is part of the Phase 2 works of the city's metro project. The report will be sent for approval from the state and central governments. Meanwhile, authorities are planning to make the 33-km stretch in Phase 1 operational by March next year.

398.title: Mumbai's suburban rail network to be blocked on Aug 21 for maintenance work
398.article_body: The Western Railway will enforce a 'jumbo block' of five hours on its suburban section on August 21 for maintenance work. The block will be implemented on the Down Fast line between Borivali and Goregaon and on the UP Slow line between Borivali and Kandivali stations from 10 am to 3 pm on Sunday.

399.title: BJP has chosen path of nation building: PM Modi
399.article_body: While addressing the 'Har Ghar Jal' event, PM Modi appreciated NDA's governance and said that it is easy to form a government, but his party has "chosen the path of building the nation...which takes hard work". He also criticised the Opposition and said, "People who do not care about the nation don't show any concern or interest towards...problems."

400.title: Unlikely he'll touch victim knowing she's Dalit: Court on harassment accused activist
400.article_body: The Kerala sessions court judge who had granted bail to writer-activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case had called Chandran "a reformist". Judge S Krishnakumar said Chandran was "fighting caste system" and that it was "highly unbelievable that he'll touch the body of the victim...knowing that she's a member of Scheduled Caste". Krishnakumar had called the victim's clothes 'provocative'.
